important_phrase: Cotton planting in Alabama and Georgia and rice planting in Louisiana and Mississippi were short of their five-year averages
Auto sales increased, particularly for light trucks and larger vehicles
Non-labor input cost pressures remained subdued, helping to support ongoing improvement in profit margins
Contacts reported increased loan demand attributed to an improved business climate rather than anticipation of higher interest rates in the near future
Trucking activity expanded as compared with year earlier levels
Incoming signals from District builders improved
Auto dealers, on the other hand, reported increased sales of light trucks and larger vehicles, which they attributed to lower gasoline prices

Stffing firms' results range from "strong" low double-digit percentage increases to flat or down slightly, while software and information technology (IT) services firms' reports are less positive, including some revenue declines

Reports from First District staffing firms are varied, with some firms citing strong business growth in the low-double-digit range, and others reporting continued softness, despite weather improvements
The manufacturer of fitness equipment reporting slower sales says it may revise its capital spending plans if the weakness continues
In Greater Boston, office leasing activity is holding steady at a solid pace and fundamentals are roughly unchanged
Most contacts are still planning for additional hiring and capital spending, as they continue to expect improvement in the US economy
Hog prices increased from their recent lows, as supplies became tighter due to a seasonal decline in production
Credit conditions improved some
Wge pressures increased slightly
Consumer credit quality improved slightly
Manufacturers of construction supplies again reported slow but steady growth
Construction and real estate activity increased modestly on balance over the reporting period
Relatively slower growth persisted in apparel and food and beverages
Spot prices for steam and metallurgical coal declined since our last report
Overall, input and finished-goods prices were steady
The pace of hiring is expected to be modest across industry sectors this year, with some bias toward replacement
Business loan portfolios expanded, but at a slow pace
Input prices were mainly flat or lower
Despite this, homebuilders remain optimistic
A strong consumer preference for SUVs and light trucks continued
Prospects for the 2015 crop year are nonetheless strong, with above-average yields expected
Price pressures remained subdued and employment held steady or increased
Retail gasoline and on-highway diesel prices increased moderately as well
Overall loan demand increased at a slower pace than in the previous report
Oilfield machinery sales remained weak and were significantly below year-earlier levels
Commercial real estate activity was generally strong, and outlooks were cautiously optimistic
Retail sales increased at a slower pace than the previous reporting period and below contacts' expectations
The slowdown in the District's energy sector persisted and expectations remained cautious
Farm income levels declined from the previous survey period, although crop conditions improved
Transportation input and output prices increased slightly, while construction materials prices declined modestly
Bankers reported a slight increase in overall loan demand, stable loan quality, and declining deposit levels since the last survey
Manufacturing activity declined sharply in April and May, while other business activity was considerably more positive
Residential real estate sales increased moderately since the previous survey period, with low- and medium-priced homes outpacing sales of higher-priced homes
Restaurant sales remained moderately weak and below year-ago levels, although contacts anticipated positive growth in coming months
The slowdown in the energy and mining sectors continued
Wge increases remained mild, with some signs of increased wage pressures; with the exception of gasoline, prices were relatively stable
Wth the exception of gasoline, prices were relatively stable
Activity at professional business services firms increased since the previous report
Commercial construction activity increased
Consumer spending increased moderately
Significant rainfall alleviated drought conditions and/or improved growing conditions in much of the Atlanta, Minneapolis, Kansas City, and Dallas Districts
Credit quality and delinquency rates were stable or improved
Districts reported stable or slightly increased prices overall during the reporting period
Credit conditions generally remained stable or improved
Stffing services demand generally grew at a stable or improved pace since the prior report
Commercial real estate leasing and construction activity improved in most districts, and outlooks were optimistic
Tourism and travel improved in several districts but showed signs of continued slowing in the New York District and moved down in Kansas City
Housing markets were steady to stronger; office and retail markets were mixed, while the market for industrial space continued to strengthen
Small to medium-sized banks in the District report widespread increases in demand across all loan categories--particularly non-residential mortgages--while demand for refinancing was unchanged
However, business contacts in most industry sectors report that activity has expanded moderately
The market for retail space has also been generally stable, with rents rising modestly in most areas
Though growth has been slow in both areas, sales activity remains at a fairly high level
Stffing firms and other general service-sector firms continued to report a moderate pace of growth; auto sales grew moderately as well--a slight pick-up in pace from the prior reporting period
Most contacts, including those from staffing firms, continued to note little significant change in wage pressures
Loans secured by real estate grew modestly, and other consumer credit lines declined slightly
New orders grew slightly, while shipments remained mostly flat
Overall, prices are rising slightly
Retail sales grew modestly over the year, on average, according to Third District contacts
Coal production decreased, although the pace of decline slowed in northern Wst Virginia
Loan demand increased moderately
Since our previous Beige Book, the demand for labor increased modestly
Loan demand increased moderately since our previous Beige Book
Services prices increased at a relatively steady pace
Realtors reported steady buyer traffic and a slight improvement in housing inventories
Sales of cars and light trucks remained robust
Capital investment in the agricultural sector expanded at a modest pace, with most spending aimed at enhancing productivity
Agricultural output expanded
Wge gains for lower skilled workers were mixed, with some contacts in the restaurant and hospitality industries reporting significant increases and others reporting limited upward pressure
Several sources reported that nonperforming loans declined and liquidity remained strong throughout the financial sector
Deliveries of commercial aircraft increased, but new orders fell significantly compared with the same period last year, suggesting slower demand growth ahead
Real estate activity expanded on balance, led by strong growth concentrated in a handful of metropolitan areas
Retail sales grew at a moderate pace
Year-to-date production is , percent lower than at the same time last year
A survey of District banks showed moderate improvement in overall lending activity

Half of contacts reported that employment during the past three months was unchanged from the same period last year, while 40 percent reported employment was higher or somewhat higher, and the remainder indicated a slight decline
For residential mortgage loans, credit standards were unchanged, demand was modestly stronger, creditworthiness of applicants improved, and delinquencies were lower
Firms that provide warehousing and storage reported new hiring and expansion plans
Home sales increased in the Eighth District on a year-over-year basis
Consumer spending grew at a modest rate since the previous report
